image.altText: Dezi Freeman pictured outside a court in Wangaratta.

props.synopsis: Dezi Freeman, the 56-year-old Porepunkah man wanted over the fatal shooting of two police officers, last year complained to a court that he had his firearms licence cancelled and lost membership to his gun club.

title.children: Suspected Porepunkah gunman complained of losing gun licence last year

image.altText: People holding Australian flags outside Parliament House in Canberra.

props.synopsis: The risk posed by the sovereign citizen movement in Australia has concerned experts and authorities for years. Now it may have become a reality, after two police officers were allegedly killed by a man who identifies with the group.Â

title.children: The sovereign citizen movement is no longer 'fringe' since the pandemic

image.altText: A close-up shot of former senator Linda Reynolds outside court, with a microphone in the corner of the shot.

props.synopsis: Former West Australian senator Linda Reynolds wins her high-profile defamation case against her ex-staffer Brittany Higgins, whom she had accused of conducting an orchestrated campaign to end her political career.

title.children: Brittany Higgins says she's moving on with her life after court loss

image.altText: a towering building is covered in futuristic red panels and laced with large silver exterior pipes

props.synopsis: Australia is being flagged as a hub for data centres but there are concerns the nation is not ready to deal with the amount of water they need to function.

title.children: A quarter of your water. Could this be the true cost of AI?

props.synopsis: You wanted to know about everything from international politics to issues closer to home, such as violence against women.

title.children: Sanctions, gas and gambling: Here's what Anthony Albanese had to say to your questions

image.altText: A house with a sign out front reading the Embassy of the Islamic Republic of Iran with the country's flag on a pole

props.synopsis: While attacks on Jews in places like Australia reinforce the narrative of Israel's right wing, certain elements within Iran see them as part of a strategy to threaten Israel and inflate Iran's power beyond its limited military and diplomatic range.

title.children: Why would Iran target Australia now? To answer that, look to Europe

image.altText: Police cars around a bus on a road

props.synopsis: Police confirm a girl was killed and at least nine other children were injured when a bus carrying nearly 30 private school students rolled just west of Geelong on the Hamilton Highway.Â

title.children: 'Confronting scenes' as girl killed in school bus rollover west of Melbourne

image.altText: Flak jackets and cameras are placed on the bodies of journalists who died in Gaza City

props.synopsis: More journalists have been killed in Gaza than in any other war, according to a report by the Costs of War Project at the Watson Institute for International and Public Affairs.

title.children: Israel has killed 240 Palestinian journalists since the war began

image.altText: Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook looking serious in a wood-paneled corridor.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump says he wants Lisa Cook removed from the board of the US central bank "immediately" but the economics professor is refusing to go, saying he has no power to remove her and, if he tries, she will sue.

title.children: Why does Trump want to remove Lisa Cook from the Fed?

image.altText: The Prime Minister of Indian hakes hands with US President Donald Trump.

props.synopsis: Relations between Washington and New Delhi have soured over India's reliance on Russian oil, with a trade deal yet to be agreed to despite five rounds of talks between the allies.

title.children: Indian goods to face 50 per cent US tariff from today

image.altText: Close up of an elderley msn. He wears black framed glasses and a blue jacket

props.synopsis: The renowned painter won the Archibald Prize twice and was known for his portraits and representations of the Australian landscape.

title.children: Archibald Prize-winning artist William Robinson has died, aged 89

image.altText: A Gold Coast Suns player leaps in the air as his teammates get ready to run through a giant banner before a game.

props.synopsis: There's one game left before finals, and the spotlight is on Carrara for Gold Coast hosting Essendon, with the Suns chasing a first-ever finals spot, as the first big move is signalled ahead of the trade period. Follow all the action in our live blog.

title.children: Suns chase history against the Bombers, as Tom De Koning chooses Saints

image.altText: An elderly couple down a mall with the help of a younger woman.

props.synopsis: Unlikely political partners have united to push the government to quickly increase the number of home care packages available to older Australians.

title.children: Unlikely allies push Labor to increase home care packages

image.altText: The exterior of a Woolworths supermarket, showing signage and down arrows with dollar signs.

props.synopsis: Consumer prices rose at their fastest rate in a year in July, according to the ABS monthly figures, but one major supermarket is no longer a beneficiary as Woolworth shares dive on disappointing profits.

title.children: Inflation resurges in July, but Woolies shares dive on emerging price war

image.altText: Bek Gillespie

props.synopsis: A night out on Bek Gillespie's first holiday as a family with her two nine-month-old twins descended into a frightening situation when oneÂ daughter put her fingers into a bowl ofÂ dumpling sauce.

title.children: Dumpling sauce alerted Bek to Australiaâs billion-dollar issue

image.altText: An aerial view of the township of Wadeye (Port Keats).

props.synopsis: Wadeye leaders are warning hundreds of remote NT residents could be displaced when the region's only barge service â the sole lifeline for food and essential supplies during the wet season â stops operating in September.

title.children: NT community warns of 'humanitarian crisis' as freight lifeline closes

image.altText: Mitchell Brown looks to kick during an AFL game for the West Coast Eagles.

props.synopsis: Former AFL player Mitch Brown creates history by becoming the first person in the league's 129-year history to reveal he is bisexual.

title.children: Ex-West Coast defender Brown becomes AFL's first openly bisexual player

image.altText: Four people walking down a set of stairs.

props.synopsis: A magistrate finds that the prosecution could not prove beyond reasonable doubt that Jessica Blinda Polsoni failed to register the birth of her child, who died in 2022.Â

title.children: Court win ends long legal ordeal for mother previously accused of murder

image.altText: Three firefighters outside a building which has orange flames coming from the roof at night.

props.synopsis: A man charged over the firebombing of a Melbourne synagogue faces court a day after the prime minister and ASIO officials say the incident is linked to the Iranian government.

title.children: Man charged over Melbourne synagogue firebombing faces court

image.altText: A man celebrates scoring a try in a rugby league match

props.synopsis: Papua New Guinea's NRL franchise has no team name, no coach, no roster, and now also has no chief executive as Andrew Hill leaves to join Panthers Group.

title.children: Papua New Guinea franchise rocked as CEO departs before NRL entry

image.altText: A man wearing a white pageboy hat and grey suspenders slings his thumbs in his trouser pockets and poses for a photo

props.synopsis: France will sue Australian live streaming platform Kick for negligence after a prominent user died during a marathon broadcast earlier this month.

title.children: France to sue Australian platform Kick over death on marathon live stream

image.altText: A stand off between a lion and a cobra

props.synopsis: An inquisitive pack of wolves and a stand-off between two dangerous animals are among the highly commended images in this year's Wildlife Photographer of the Year competition.

title.children: The highly commended images from the Wildlife Photographer of the Year

image.altText: Matt and Kaia leaving court

props.synopsis: The prosecution has finished its closing arguments in the trial of Matt Wright, with the defence expected to begin its closing address tomorrow before the jury starts deliberations.Â

title.children: Prosecution finishes closing arguments in Matt Wright trial â as it happened

image.altText: Offshore wind turbines in the ocean, with a blue sky overhead.

props.synopsis: European developers vying for a place in WA's controversial offshore wind farm have received two further preliminary feasibility licences.

title.children: Preliminary licences granted for controversial offshore WA wind farm

image.altText: Exterior of Busy Bees New Lambton with a bee in the logo

props.synopsis: Busy Bees New Lambton failed to report a serious fall until a child presented to hospital nearly a month later with a fractured skull, budget estimates has heard.

title.children: Child diagnosed with fractured skull a month after childcare centre fall

image.altText: A head shot of a man with fair hair tied back, wearing a suit and tie

props.synopsis: A Perth teacher and babysitter pleads guilty to more than two dozen child sex charges, with at least one of his victims an infant.

title.children: Perth babysitter pleads guilty to child sex charges, some against infant

image.altText: A man sits on the steps leading to his front door, posing for a photo, holding a photograph

props.synopsis: Family members who have found out specimens from their loved ones' bodies had been retained by a pathology museum without consent are waiting for the coroner's investigation to finish before they decide what their next steps will be.

title.children: Devastated families may take legal action over museum that kept body parts

image.altText: A general view of the Australia Post Office with a man walking and a car on the road

props.synopsis: Many Australians and small businesses are scrambling for information as a Trump administration tariff on low-value packages looms.Â

title.children: Australia Post halts parcel deliveries to the US â so what if you need to send a package?

image.altText: Liz is mid-speech, sitting behind a microphone in the studio. She has brown long hair and wears a denim shirt.

props.synopsis: Liz Allen says she has concerns about a group set up by the ANU to oversee an investigation into bullying allegations she has made against senior leaders, including Chancellor Julie Bishop.

title.children: ANU academic concerned about group overseeing bullying investigation

image.altText: A woman looks at the camera with a fairly blank expression.

props.synopsis: Wee Waa residents are frustrated by a lack of detail after being told their hospital would return to 24/7 opening hours.

title.children: Town pushes for 24/7 operations at hospital that closes at 5:30pm

title.children: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce announce their engagement

image.altText: Woman with sunglasses on head.

props.synopsis: A judges dismiss an appeal against the sentence handed to domestic violence murderer Tyrone Thompson, which was described by the Crown as "manifestly inadequate".

title.children: Mother sobs after appeal against sentence for DV murderer fails

image.altText: A firefighter fights a blaze at Yanchep.

props.synopsis: Parts of Western Australia, South Australia and Victoria will see increased fire risk this spring, as emergency services unveil their outlook for the season.Â

title.children: Spring bushfire outlook points to busy season for emergency services

image.altText: A hand places bean seeds into a shallow soil trench

props.synopsis: Growing edible plants from seeds can be cheaper than buying seedlings. Here are some of the easiest varieties to grow â plus thrifty ways to find them.

title.children: Veggies and herbs you can easily grow from seeds
